required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CSTC1 for Diabetic Foot Ulcers Phase II Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized,Double-Blind,Vehicle-controlled,Parallel,Phase II Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of CSTC1 in Patient With Diabetic Foot Ulcers

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of CSTC1 in patient with diabetic foot ulcers.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of complete ulcer closure during up to 12 weeks of treatment period
primary_outcome.description: Complete ulcer closure is defined as 100% skin re-epithelialization without drainage or dressing requirements confirmed at two consecutive study visits 2 weeks apart.

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the time to complete ulcer closure
Defined as the time to half ulcer closure
The proportion of ulcer closure at each post-treatment visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in ulcer size
secondary_outcome.description: The ulcer size at each post-treatment visit minus the ulcer size at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage change in ulcer size for each post-treatment visit
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated as (Ulcer size at post treatment visit - Ulcer size at baseline)/(Ulcer size at baseline)

other_outcome.measure: Net change from baseline in laboratory test results
Net change from baseline in vital signs

arm_group.description: CSTC1 (vapor fraction from seeds of Glycine max (L.) Merr. and composition thereof), topical, two times daily
Matched vehicle, topical, two times daily

intervention.description: vapor fraction from seeds of Glycine max (L.) Merr. and composition thereof

overall_official.affiliation: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

facility.name: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital
